intro: Neomolina bogotensis, commonly known as the Bogotá fern, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and sorrel plants. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Neomolina bogotensis is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and rocky slopes.
